content.description: On the backside of Ship Rock from the approach trail is a large, 45 degree wall with a rusty ladder on its right side. To the left is a large, slopey rail. Start on the rail, moving through the good incut about 5' above the rail, just over the lip. From here, use sidepulls and committing high feet to reach better holds above. If you want, top out to the boulder's precipice. Otherwise, at the ledge, traverse to the ladder for the downclimb.
content.location: This is on the backside of the boulder on the Big 45 left of the ladder.

From the front of the boulder, head right around the sheer face all the way to the end where the metal rung ladder is and start on the steep, obvious undercut arete. Alternatively, this problem is about 12-15 feet right of the problem Boots on the Ground.

content.description: Sit start deep in the cave. Make a low traverse left on crimps and pods out the rising seam. Turn onto the face, make a move or two, and then drop off as the face appears featureless.
content.location: From the front of the boulder, walk left around the erratic to the second cave, crawl in, and give it a go.

content.description: Start with your hands in the obvious crack, get over the bulge, and finish on easy slab to the top.
content.location: This is on the West face, immediately right of the small tree that touches the rock.

content.description: Squat start the tall face on beautiful rounded holds to a high ball top out at 25 feet.
content.location: From the front of the boulder, head right around the long, sheer face almost to the end. This problem begins about 8-10 feet left of the problem Packing Heat.

content.description: Stand start the steep, blank wall matched on a pointy knob. The grade is an estimate.
content.location: From the front of the boulder, head right around the sheer face for about 25 feet or so, and look for the noticeable knob at roughly head height.

content.description: Start in the back of the cave, near the anti-Cody graffiti, on a pair of deep, slopey incuts in the seam. Follow the seam out the roof to an interesting encounter as the roof gives way to vertical climbing. Quest up the slab above the top of the boulder, some 35 feet up. The first pedestal (directly under the start) is "on", but the larger one to the right is "off". This seems like a contrivance but will make sense when you're there (the second pedestal is essentially the ground under the boulder).
content.protection: A few pads and a good head for the slab.
content.location: It is in the middle of the obvious, giant roof.

content.description: Ship Rock is a huge, glacial erratic near Boston.
